overview: This subject provides students with the opportunity to plan and execute a research-based projects under supervision. Specific research projects will depend upon the availability of appropriate expertise but may address a broad range of epidemiological issues.
Students will be required to undertake a minor research project in one of the following categories:

Students enrolled in the Master of Science (Epidemiology program) are required to complete a 25-point Research Project.  Students will need to discuss and receive approval for their proposed Research Project with the course coordinator to ensure they will have completed a total of 25 points by the end of their course.

necessary pre-requisite: Note: the following subject/s can also be taken concurrently (at the same time)

assessments.description: Research Project Progress Review. Hurdle requirement:. Pass/Fail
assessments.timing: Due late in the second semester of enrolment
Due late in the second semester of enrolment

assessments.description: A Written report for the project. Up to a maximum of 8000 words. 8000 words

assessments.description:
Supervisor's Evaluation based on:

assessments.timing: Due during the examination period of the second semester of enrolment

Semester 1.Contact hours: 44 hours over 2 consecutive semesters: attendance at a half-day research training skills workshop (week 1 of semester), attendance at 2 full-day sessions for student oral presentations (week 11: of each semester) and fortnightly supervisor meetings

Semester 2.Contact hours: 44 hours over 2 consecutive semesters: attendance at a half-day research training skills workshop (week 1 of semester), attendance at 2 full-day sessions for student oral presentations (week 11: of each semester) and fortnightly supervisor meetings

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.

Subject notes: This subject is only for students enrolled in the Master of Science - Epidemiology
